trial_identification.studytitle: Paclitaxel-coated Peripheral Stents Used in the Treatment of Femoropopliteal Stenoses
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Paclitaxel-coated Peripheral Stents Used in the Treatment of Femoropopliteal Stenoses

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: devices - Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent Treatment: devices - Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent with slower-dissolving polymer-free paclitaxel coating Treatment: devices - Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent with higher-dose polymer-free paclitaxel coating
Experimental: Stent 1 - Zilver® PTX Stent
Experimental: Stent 2 - Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent with slower-dissolving polymer-free paclitaxel coating
Experimental: Stent 3 - Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent with higher-dose polymer-free paclitaxel coating
Treatment: devices: Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent Paclitaxel belongs to the Taxane drug class and coated on the stent at a much lower dose than when administered as a chemotherapy agent.
Treatment: devices: Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent with slower-dissolving polymer-free paclitaxel coating Paclitaxel belongs to the Taxane drug class and coated on the stent at a much lower dose than when administered as a chemotherapy agent.
Treatment: devices: Zilver® Paclitaxel-Eluting Peripheral Stent with higher-dose polymer-free paclitaxel coating Paclitaxel belongs to the Taxane drug class and coated on the stent at a much lower dose than when administered as a chemotherapy agent.

primaryOutcome.outcome: The percent diameter stenosis within the study lesion evaluated by conventional angiography. - Percent diameter stenosis will be calculated by comparing the minimal lumen diameter to the average of the proximal and distal reference vessel diameters.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- One de novo or restenosed artherosclerotic lesion with = 50% diameter stenosis
- Symptoms of peripheral arterial disease (Rutherford 2-4)
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- Pregnant, breastfeeding, or planning to become pregnant in the next 5 years
- Less than 18 years old
- Medical condition or disorder that would limit life expectancy to less than 12 months or that may cause noncompliance with the protocol or confound the data analysis
- Previous stent in the study vessel

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This randomized multi-center study is intended to compare different coatings on stents for treatment of lesions of the above-the-knee femoropopliteal artery.
